greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Consider the mapping f(a/b) = (a - b)/(ab). Taking a = 2 b = 1 to start with and carrying out this mapping repeatedly on each new (reduced) rational number gives the following sequence 2/1,1/2,-1/2,-3/-2,-1/6,... Sequence contains the denominators.
comment: The mapping f(a/b) = (a + b)/(a - b). Taking a = 2 b = 1 to start with and carrying out this mapping repeatedly on each new (reduced)rational number gives the periodic sequence 2/1,3/1,2/1,3/1,...
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..26
program: # Variant with first four terms slightly different. Absolute values.
a = A081478_abs(); print([next(a) for i in range(17)])  # _Peter Luschny_, Dec 17 2015
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Mar 24 2003
ext: More terms from Antonio G. Astudillo (afg_astudillo(AT)lycos.com), Apr 06 2003
